fields.summary: LLAP: query 17 tasks fail due to mapjoin issue

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The multi-threaded performance takes a serious hit when LLAP shares hashtables between the probe threads running in parallel. 

!hashmap-sync.png!

This is an explicit synchronized block inside ReusableRowContainer which triggers this particular pattern.

!hashmap-sync-source.png!

Looking deeper into the code, the synchronization seems to be caused due to the fact that WriteBuffers.setReadPoint modifies the otherwise read-only hashtable.

To generate this sort of result, run LLAP at a WARN log-level, to avoid all the log synchronization that otherwise affects the thread sync.
fields.summary: BytesBytesMultiHashMap does not allow concurrent read-only access

comments.body: Yeah, we are fixing this right now. It also causes bugs aplenty. I have a patch, just need to finish the bloody merge before I build and test it
Oh, sync blocks were added by Gunther
rather, bugs were before sync blocks were added earlier today.

[~sershe]: we need to reverse the duplicate markers.

Re-opening this one, since this came up today & isn't related to the read-only issue.

I have a suggestion here - how about we return a shallow-copy for seal() ?
Git is down, so merge won't propagate. I will attach the patch here for now, to commit I need to merge and I cannot deal with SVN today anymore
As for logging, I have a patch for that that someone needs to +1 ;)

The log-level set to WARN level is not really a patch - as long as we log at INFO level, we have issues with synchronization unless we switch to async logging.

Will gladly +1, if you have a patch to add to the {{hive --service llap --loglevel}} option, that avoids me having to edit the JSON configs before running run.sh.

Fix looks good, the hashmap sync points have gone away from the inner loops.

!hashmap-after.png!

The orange sections are the IO elevator lagging behind the map-join operator.

Found other init-time lock sections, will file more JIRAs.
Patch for trunk. [~ashutoshc] can you review? thanks
Meanwhile, already committed to llap
https://reviews.apache.org/r/32637/

ATTACHMENT ID: 12708229 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
I don't know enough about this part of code base to review. I assume [~gopalv] , [~hagleitn] understands this better, so will be better reviewer.
[~sershe] can you please update the review board entry with the latest patch?
debugDumpMetrics is marked as not thread safe, but MapJoinOp will call this concurrently in llap (clopeOp). Can you provide a threadsafe version?

maybe it's because it's late, but it seems you're not actually using the threadLocalHashMap in the container. That seems to kind of defeat the purpose. Also, I think threadLocalHashMap is a confusing name for a "getter".

Is there a reason to keep the non thread safe methods around? You could just force everyone to use a getter object w/ position to access right? There wouldn't be a perf overhead as far as I can tell.

Here's my +1 from yesterday. Since it's already tomorrow, you should be able to check this in today.

bq.  Here's my +1 from yesterday. Since it's already tomorrow, you should be able to check this in today.

Hm, sounds logical.  But (putting on my quibbling cap) isn't the one-day delay supposed to give _other_ people a chance to weigh in?

Committed to trunk (already in llap branch), thanks [~sershe] & [~hagleitn].

[~mmccline]: Fyi, you can rebase your pending patches on top of this change.
This issue has been fixed and released as part of the 1.2.0 release. If you find an issue which seems to be related to this one, please create a new jira and link this one with new jira.
